revised_title: George Gaylord Simpson: A Pioneering Vertebrate Paleontologist
tldr: George Gaylord Simpson was a renowned vertebrate paleontologist who made significant contributions to the study of Mesozoic and Cenozoic mammals. He worked at the American Museum of Natural History and later became a professor at Harvard University. Simpson is known for his work on the biogeography of mammals, quantitative zoology, and principles of taxonomy. His book "Tempo and Mode in Evolution" is considered a groundbreaking work in the field of evolutionary biology.
